channel.title: I frigin' hate Pachter!
channel.description:
Goddamn that Michael Pachter, why does every single game website treat him like the de facto expert on the videogame industry?
The guy doesn't play videogames, he has no feeling whatsoever what gamers want and how the industry (fails to) deliver. For an industry analyst he knows jack fucking shit about the industry. And what little he does know is confined to console games, the fact that the PC is a more open platform and that games are cheaper on the PC is unknown to him.
This is the guy who encourages publishers to charge $15-$20 for a stupid little mappack, he's basically encouraging publishers like Activision (who are already greedy as fuck) to squeeze every last penny from people.
All he does is make these broad generalizations that every other moron with half a brain can make, and sell it as his expert opinion.
The only guy more obnoxious than Pachter is Bobby feckin' Kotick!

I will not buy games from these companies. Ever!

item.title: I frigin' hate Pachter!
item.dc:creator: Pokemon_Eater
item.description:
Doom:

Okay, he advises game developers and publishers to exploit dumb people by continually producing shitty stuff and selling it for high prices.

The thing I find wrong with this, is that this makes the whole industry worse. They produce games which becomes worse and worse, and we have to deal with it because dumb people still buy it. Now I don’t know about you, but I think that’s a bad deal.

Well, then that means I’m dumb then since I buy video games. So fuck this guy, which was my point in the first place since he also tried exploiting smart people.

Read full topic

item.title: I frigin' hate Pachter!
item.dc:creator: jerry
item.description:
In my obviously-knowing-nothing-about-games opinion: the plot of Modern Warfare 2 was the dumbest thing I’ve ever seen; my jaw was dropping while I was playing. I felt worse shooting American troops than I did Russian civilians. What cracks me up is that I read all the “No Russian” criticism about being put in the role of a terrorist, but being in the role of a guy gunning down American troops is worse. Not to say killing civilians is a good thing.

true, and the “No Russian” thing was WAY to much criticized, it wasn’t that bad (no offense)

Read full topic

item.title: I frigin' hate Pachter!
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
I like this part

And Sony - I’m not sure if they had a firm agreement but they may have had a handshake - said to Take-Two, “You’ve got to give us something else.” And the “something else” was a zombie game that Rockstar wanted to work on. But while Rockstar was in the planning phase, Dead Rising came out and Left 4 Dead was announced. Rockstar realised they were up against a saturated market and Valve, and, “What can we possibly do that will be any better than what Valve’s done?” They started again and that’s when they came up with the idea of The Agent, which nobody actually knows what it is. That is the back story.

Read full topic
